fields.summary: After installing newer version, older version stays in Add/Remove programs and can not be uninstalled

fields.description:
---------------------------
Error encountered
---------------------------
'hg status' failed with code 255: abort: repository C:\Users\saz\AppData\Local\Temp\cyhqd1iw.opc not found!
 (C:\projects\projectName)
---------------------------
OK

fields.summary: Abusing 'hg status' failed with code 255 message box

fields.description:
I like the appearance of the updated GUI, but I think there is too much padding in the repository browser. I've attached screenshots to show the difference between 1.6.23.0 and 1.9.1.1-beta. While I like the appearance and the new icons, the extra padding takes up a significant amount of extra width on the screen.

Perhaps the padding could be reduced? Or make the panel collapsible? If the panel is collapsible it might be useful to display information about the current branch in a status bar. The information could take the same format at the bookmark bar.
fields.summary: Reduce the padding in the repo browser

fields.description: Screen real estate is at a premium in SourceTree (especially using a 4:3 monitor) so I work with the bookmarks hidden. However, I find it annoying to use the menu or keyboard to show and hide the bookmarks. I think it would be nice to collapse the bookmark bar to the side of the application in a similar style to windows within Visual Studio.
fields.summary: Make the bookmarks bar collapsible

fields.description:
When I try to stash my changes, I get back this error report:

{{git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false stash save loadingView
      0 [main] us 0 init_cheap: VirtualAlloc pointer is null, Win32 error 487
AllocationBase 0x0, BaseAddress 0x68570000, RegionSize 0x260000, State 0x10000
C:\Users\Albert\AppData\Local\Atlassian\SourceTree\git_local\bin\sh.exe: *** Couldn't reserve space for cygwin's heap, Win32 error 0}}
fields.summary: Stash failed

fields.description: BUGBUGBUGBUGBUGBUGBUGBUGBUGBUGBUGBUGBUGBUGBUGBUGBUG
fields.summary: Test bug

fields.description: Source tree freezes after selecting a file for commit and immediately clicking on "Commit" button. Enter comment before selecting file. Video attached.
fields.summary: Source tree freezing, not responding on Commit

fields.description:
When I click Merge "Production" into current branch the confirm message is:

"Are you sure you want to merge 'File Status' into your current branch?" (see attachment)

----------------------------------------------------
Merge file status (see attachment):

git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false merge "File Status"
merge: File Status - not something we can merge

Completed with errors, see above.
-----------------------------------------------------

Note: Same issues is happening when I try to merge any two branches using the right click "merge xxx into current branch", or try to delete a branch (attachment).

See like the selection on the tree is not working properly and every time it jumps to the top of the tree, that is "File Status".
fields.summary: SourceTree referencing 'File Status' instead of branch or stash name

fields.description:
If I start SourceTree after installation, at the step "Atlasstion account" if I press "use an existing account", a window opens and show the error:
Navigation to the webpage was canceled 

if I refresh, it shows:
This program cannot display the webpage
fields.summary: Cannot setup SourceTree after installation - This page cannot be displayed error

fields.description: Frequently (but not always), trying to take an action on a checked out branch with the right-click popup menu will produce an error stating that the action cannot be taken on File Status.  It appears that SourceTree is losing its selection and defaulting to the top element: the File Status section.  Attached screenshot shows an attempted merge that ends up trying to affect File Status.
fields.summary: Popup Menu (right-click) on checked out branch intermittently targets "File Status" instead of branch.

fields.description: New user. Was asked to register for an account and generate a license, which I did. I then download the license. On the website is says: "Within SourceTree select from the menu bar "SourceTree > Registration", click "Import License" to import the downloaded the license file." but there is no such menu and nowhere else that I can find where a license can be imported.
fields.summary: Cannot import license

fields.description: When attempting to delete an empty folder or a repository, SourceTree warns that the operation will delete all bookmarks.
fields.summary: Deleting Bookmark Warns Against Deleting All Bookmarks

fields.description:
Crash when try to delete project with the same name as a folder.

Step to reproduce:
1) Create folder "name1"
2) Clone project "name1"
3) Try to delete.

Description:
  There is no way to fix this project. Button "rename" is disabled. Moving into another folder create a strange copy of link to this broken project.
fields.summary: Crash when try to delete project with the same name as a folder.

fields.description:
Investigate if the SpellChecker performance can be improved by pre-emptively loading the dictionary file and avoiding reading from disk repeatedly.

see https://support.atlassian.com/browse/STSP-4003

*Work Around*

Disable the SpellChecker 
!Capture.PNG|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Spellchecker Performance

fields.description: I have to continually exit and restart SourceTree to get any refresh status including Pull. Once I restart, I have to actually "Fetch" at times before I see any updates. I have the option set to do a refresh every 2 minutes.
fields.summary: Pull/Fetch is not working

fields.description: The new user interface for Source Tree is very difficult for people who have vision difficulty. The toolbar icons are now just pencil lines. Can you please go back to the old icons?
fields.summary: The toolbar icons are difficult to see

fields.description: Resolving multiple conflicts at once where one or more are files could not updated does not say which files failed. Find attached image with example of not so helpful information when attempting to resolve a large amount of changes.
fields.summary: Error while resolving multiple conflicts lack any useful information.

fields.description:
When performing a search on the file status tab the search works as expected unless the backspace key is pressed. Arrow keys and the delete key are fine. Clearing the text by clicking the cross in the search box is also fine.

This issue does not appear to be present in 1.6.23.0.

There seem to be lots of bugs reporting the same or similar issue:

SRCTREEWIN-5340
SRCTREEWIN-5223
SRCTREEWIN-5646
SRCTREEWIN-5293
SRCTREEWIN-5261
SRCTREEWIN-4953
SRCTREEWIN-5521
SRCTREEWIN-5292
SRCTREEWIN-5323
fields.summary: Crash using search in the file status tab

fields.description:
Had a repository configured.
Moved repository on disk. When doubleclicking on project in source tree, a message box appears saying "Repository Missing" with options of "Change folder" and "Remove bookmark".
Selecting Change folder doesn't work, as the message box re-appears. 

Then cancelling the action. The project seems still to be missing, but the path is correctly updated. 
When restarting Sourcetree, the project is now back fine.
fields.summary: Repository Missing after folder moved and updated

fields.description:
Let's say branch A and branch B. In branch A there's no submodule, and in branch B there is one submodule. It doesn't matter where it is or what it's called.

Switching to branch B (with submodule) updates it and all's fine and dandy.

Switching back to branch A (does NOT contain that submodule), the submodule does not get deleted from the filesystem. It's as if it's always been there.

If I then delete the submodule manually, ST does not detect a change, which is correct. So why does ST not delete a submodule that isn't supposed to be there anymore?
fields.summary: Switching branch does not update submodules

fields.description: Spell check's Add to dictionary command does not work. I request this but still get the same word marked as misspelled.
fields.summary: Add to dictionary does not work
souretree crashed when browse unstashed file

fields.description:
I am working in an environment having multiple (~30) repos.
These repos are also manipulated (pulled) by .sh scripts on Windows. 
Currently the only way to update the status of all repos is to open them one by one and use fetch to get the updates. this is very long and tedious.
Please add a "Refresh All" or "Fetch All" button.
An alternative way will be to select multiple repos and press Fetch for a subset of all the repos.
Thanks!
fields.summary: Force refresh(fetch) of all (or multiple) repos

fields.description: Installed from bitbucket.org clone link. Attempted to clone repository from end of setup flow.
fields.summary: Crash during first clone after install

fields.description: Hi! After updating to the last version I can't start SourceTree: nothing happens after signing in. Use Windows 10.
fields.summary: Error after udating to the last version: can't start the app

fields.description:
It seems that the flag "show remotes branches" is saved globally
 !image-2016-05-09-11-27-58-560.png|thumbnail! 

If I change the option, all the bookmars I will open after will get the same value of the flag.

Can this flag be saved for single repository? 
For different repository I need to use different values

Same issue for the Date/Ancestor order
fields.summary: Flag "show remote branches" configured per single repository

fields.description: SourceTree on Windows 10 on a VMWare VDI pc. I have staged files (35 staged files), when I begin to use the search function, I become the error
fields.summary: Search file on file status tab

fields.description:
While creating a patch file sourcetree 1.8.3.0 gives an error "Please select atleast one file" while I am not able to select file. The files are only moving from stage to unstage and vice versa but not able select files.
I searched and there are others also who are facing the same issue.
fields.summary: Not able to select any file while creating patch

fields.description: In previous versions it was possible to add additional remotes to a Git repository through the context menu on the "Remotes" node. With current version this is no longer possible and it needs to be done through the repository settings dialog, which is not as obvious to users as the context menu.
fields.summary: Add Remote no longer possible through context menu

fields.description:
The commit pane could inform the user if the commit title is more than 50 chars. See the proposed UI design attached 

A broader implementation would be a generic implementation that will display warnings based on the formatting guideline the user provides.
(see git best practices on commit message : http://chris.beams.io/posts/git-commit/)
fields.summary: Show warnings about the commit message on the commit pane to encourage best practices

fields.description:
Very often I get this kind of errpr

{code:java}
git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false checkout develop
fatal: Unable to create 'xxxxxxxx/.git/index.lock': File exists.

If no other git process is currently running, this probably means a
git process crashed in this repository earlier. Make sure no other git
process is running and remove the file manually to continue.

Completed with errors, see above.
{code}

This kind of error occurs during any operation, switching branch, creating hotfix, pulling data, ...

I can assure you that there are no other git process running and no crashes has been reported.

I'm unable to find a proper step to reproduce the problem, It seems to be a bit random
fields.summary: Unable to create index.lock, already exists

fields.description: Having to do a push in order to get it rejected because you dont have all your changes, to having to do a pull after in order to get those changes and then having to do a push doesnt make any sense, make a button that does everything please :)
fields.summary: Feature Request : Add Pull+Push button in Bitbucket :)

fields.description:
Source tree crashed

Logs attached [^sourcetree.log]
fields.summary: Source tree crashed

fields.description:
Can you provide a mechanism to turn off the circular mask for the repository icons.

Our icons are not circular – by masking them you are either making the icons look crappy by cutting of the corners. or forcing us to make our icons small enough to fit into the circular mask, making them crappy by losing detail and get rid of the frame – Our icons don't have frames – we should have to see the frames.

They are our icons. I would like to see them as we intended.

Thanks
fields.summary: Customer request: Provide a mechanism to turn off circular mask on repository icons

fields.description:
Right now you can only move an existing TAG when the tag exists locally. If you try to Move it while the TAG exists on a remote you will get an error.

The "move Existing" should work for local and remote, or provide an option for either.
fields.summary: Move existing TAG on remotes
Application crashed on submodule URL change

fields.description: Recently I upgraded to Sourcetree 1.8.3 for windows. I am using windows 7 with decent hardware. Earlier I was using sourcetree 1.6 and it was fine. With latest update, sourcetree will not refresh after git pull has been completed, or if I have staged files or unstage files. If I restart sourcetree, it updates the screen. I have tried refresh from menu and using F5. Both doesn't not seem to be doing the job for me.
fields.summary: Sourcetree won't refresh after git pull, stage/unstage files

fields.description:
I had a developer who was setting up a new system after a hard disk crash. He had installed GIT on windows, and when he installed Sourcetree had missed the option to enable GIT. When he got ready to clone his first repo locally, Sourcetree just kept showing "invalid URL" and then if you clicked "details" the message box was blank.
I would think that if you have not enabled either Mercurial or GIT a clearer warning would be shown.
fields.summary: Better messaging on a fresh install if GIT is not enabled.

fields.description:
SourceTree app popups every few seconds a dialog window with request to enter my password for BitBucket account. I'm 100% sure that I'm entering correct password, but after I click to "Login" it popups again (without any error message). I'm using SSH for my repositories so I can push/pull changes without problems, but this message box is very annoying.

 !image-2016-05-05-10-25-24-083.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Bitbucket authentication window popups every few seconds

fields.description:
It doesn't matter if SourceTree's in full size or random window size - minimizing it and opening it again caused it to be blur. 

!source_tree_fonts_issue.png|thumbnail! 

Workaround: Change SourceTree's window size in any way when SourceTree becomes blur solves the issue, and it'll occur again if SourceTree is minimized again.

Some details:
Resolution: 1920x1080px.
fields.summary: SourceTree's text becomes blur after minimizing it.

fields.description:
I downloaded the latest version of SourceTree from the website and tried to install it, which succeeds! But when I try to open the application it will just not do anything. I have tried running as administrator, uninstalling, rebooting, running CCleaner and rebooting then reinstalling. Nothing seems to work.

Would be great to get some help with this. Did a quick search and didn't find anything.

Thanks,
Ally
fields.summary: Sourcetree 1.8 Installs but will not open

fields.description:
I often work with many repositories and I have lot of tabs in the bar.
My feature suggestion is to provide a contextual menu with "Close others" or "Close all" from a single tab
fields.summary: Right-Click on open bookmark and offer "Close others"

fields.description:
Open the clone / add / create dialog for the first time with the person who is the repository SourceTree, the destination of the path of the Repository Creation tab: You specified a "C \ Users \ USERNAME".
Press the Create button, delete the repository after confirming that the repository has been created.
In addition, a variety of files that are not locked in because you choose to delete the repository on the hard disk has been removed.
And that party was totally furious.

I think that normal operation personally, but such poor people will thank the support so that it does not appear again.
fields.summary: Do not be created When any file is in the midst of the directory when you specify a repository when creating a destination path, please do warning comes out.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

If a user wants to create an annotated tag with a message that includes e.g. quotations, he will have to escape them. Otherwise, the tag creation will fail, e.g.:
 !Screen Shot 2016-05-04 at 11.10.46.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution

Interpret everything typed in annotated tags message field as an explicit value and escape characters that would have a special interpretation by bash or git.
fields.summary: Escape special characters in tag message field

fields.description:
Trying to fetch from a host of which Putty has already cached an ed25519 host key (ssh-ed25519@22:<hostname>), results in the following error message:
{noformat}
The server's host key is not cached in the registry. You
have no guarantee that the server is the computer you
think it is.
The server's rsa2 key fingerprint is:
ssh-rsa 2048 <fingerprint>
{noformat}

So it looks like the cached ed25519 host key is ignored.
fields.summary: SourceTree ignores host key types other than rsa2 when putty/plink is used with Git.

fields.description:
Take note of the file lol.txt:

If user clicks spacebar with the intend to stage the file, it will not work (despite the UI showing the box being checked):

!commitstatus.JPG|thumbnail! 

The commit button won't be enabled because it is not staged:

!commitspacebar.JPG|thumbnail! 

Everything works well if mouse is used to check the box:

!commitclick.JPG|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Staging via spacebar does not stage the file and enable commit button.

fields.description:
I left Source Tree opened on PC four days ago. Today i saw it had had 2 GB private memory.
The info from ProcessHacker in attachments.
fields.summary: The huge memory leak

fields.description: Changes do not automatically refresh after doing actions in the terminal. It should check for changes when the window regains focus. This is a new issue with 1.9.5.0.
fields.summary: Log/History does not automatically refresh after external changes

fields.description:
Edit Hosting Account with email address as email results an invalid error.

Steps
1.  Hosted Repositories (Gear Icon)
2.  Pres Edit Accounts (With no existing accounts)
3.  Select "Bitbucket Server"
4.  Leave Host URL as: https://bitbucket.org/
5.  Enter user name:  I used "rlove@peakbiz.com"
6.  Login Status immediately says "Login Failed"
   -  I have not entered a password, why should it even be trying.

7.  Press "Why"
The ';' character, hexadecimal value 0x3B, cannot be included in a name.  Line 7, Position 314.

I do know this is not the way use the Bitbucket hosting service :-)   I am just trying to break things.
fields.summary: Edit Hosting Account

fields.description:
Steps
1. Remove all accounts for Repositories.
2. View "Hosted Repositories" via Gear Icon

Actual: Spinning Cursor appears in the middle of screen.   Indicating work is occurring when none is actually occurring.
Expected:   Alternative message/indicator prompting users to edit accounts and add an account.

3. Add an Account for bitbucket (hosted) only.

Actual: Bitbucket Repositories appear, Spinning Cursor appears in the middle of screen.   Indicating work is occurring when none is actually occurring.
Expected:   Spinning Cursor to go away.
fields.summary: Hosted Repositories - Spinning Progress Indicator

fields.description:
During install when you get to the "Downloading version Control Systems..."
You have no indication of progress.     I have been on this page for more than 5 minutes now  wondering when I will be able to press continue.      So that this is not a blocker I will press "Skip Setup".

Screen shot of where hung up during install has been attached.
fields.summary: Install Downloading Version Control Systems lacks progress to know if hung

Hello,
I got this errore while I was opening an Hotfix on my project.

Even with restarting SourceTree beta the problem still remains.
Using the normal SourceTree installation the Hotfix has been properly done

I used the beta installation since some days, and I did not installed other versions or other software

Attached to this issue the full stack dump

Sometimes when I open the software I get the toolbar with the icons but without the labels (not all of them)
 !image-2016-05-03-10-34-29-308.png|thumbnail! 

Sadly, I'm unable to reproduce the problem, it seems to be random.

fields.description:
I'm using the keyboard to select files to commit.

Commit-button only seems to be enabled by the mouse-click handler.

Why you no update button based on file-selected-status instead of mouse-click? ;-)
fields.summary: Marking a file with space (instead of click) does not enable commit button

fields.description:
When using CI tools such as Jenkins, lots of commits are created by automatic version number management (i. e. increasing the version numbers after release builds).
This clutters the whole branch view, making it difficult identifying the significant commits done by the engineers.
I would love to have an option to filter out these commits from the branch overview incl. graph (i. e. 'do not show any commits that have <regex> as author').
fields.summary: Filter for auto-generated commits in branch view

fields.description: Every time one selects a file for staging, unstaged file list is reordered.
fields.summary: Unstaged files order is resetted upon staging files for a commit
Support for high resolution screens

fields.description: The toolbar with icons takes too much space, also the tabs are too big, if we have an option to have them more compacted it would be nice.
fields.summary: Tabs and toolbar compact view

fields.description: It would be nice to have sorting possibility to bookmarks window as when there are many bookmarks it gets a bit trivial. Also have an option to have the bookmarks with a compact view where only the bookmark name is shown. Even a search for bookmark would be nice
fields.summary: Add sorting possibility for bookmarks view and compact item and search

fields.description: Clicking "Unstage Hunk" toggles buttons to (disabled) "Stage Hunk" and "Discard Hunk".  I have to select another file to unstage another hunk.
fields.summary: Unstage Hunk

fields.description:
When first accessing an SSH server the server's key is not cached and the user is prompted to accept it. Previously when this happened with PuTTY (plink.exe), it would fail and we would detect the prompt, ask the user to accept the key, then run a separate invocation of plink to save the key in the registry before re-trying.

As of the latest version, the initial plink call actually hangs waiting for user input instead of failing. The user must manually run plink on the command line to be able to accept the key. This is unintuitive and the user may not realise this is the workaround.

One way to make plink fail rather than hang on the prompt would be to pass the `-batch` flag to the call. However, this is problematic:

# You cannot pass flags to `GIT_SSH`
# Using `GIT_SSH_COMMAND` instead does allow you to pass flags, but this doesn't work with custom ports (typical for Bitbucket Server). This is because plink requires that ports are specified with `-P` instead of `-p`, and git only does this substitution when it detects that `GIT_SSH` is set to plink, not with `GIT_SSH_COMMAND`.
# Using a wrapper script (a .cmd so that it's launchable from both Bash and Windows hooks/filters) would also work but again suffers from the same problem with the lack of `-P` port argument conversion. Git only converts to `-P` if the target of GIT_SSH is *exactly* "plink.exe" or "plink". Any other name will not trigger the conversion.

A possible option might be to write a replacement plink.exe which is just in a different folder and which calls the original plink but with the `-batch` flag. This is somewhat confusing though. Raising this here for future discussion as it has impacted a recent customer support request (as a side effect).
fields.summary: SSH with PuTTY can hang if server key is unknown

fields.description:
Most of the time when a merge conflict occurs, sourcetree automatically stages the files that still contain the merge metadata (i.e. it wants me to commit broken files).

It shows these files as being modified. Some files do have the "conflict" icon but are still automatically staged and NOT resolved. 
If I unstage these files, they are still only "modified". I have to first find all of them (from possibly hundreds of files), then unstage them one by one and then restart the merge for them.

We have had it happen more than once now, that unresolved conflicts were simply committed to the repository. This breaks A LOT of things!
fields.summary: Merge conflicts not detected

fields.description: the first time in commit view when i stage a hunk, then the focus is set to the staged file, but would have to stay on the unstaged file
fields.summary: wrong focus, when staging a hunk

we have uninstalled, rebooted, reinstall, rebooted.

We have also Unloaded AV and tried again - Same issue.

See Events the following errors from the windows event log

fields.description:
It is related to attempt to edit the app.config (requires elevation of privilege) file while running you can detect it in the event log:
Application: SourceTree.exe
Framework Version: v4.0.30319
Description: The process was terminated due to an unhandled exception.
Exception Info: System.Xml.XmlException
   at System.Xml.XmlTextReaderImpl.Throw(System.Exception)
   at System.Xml.XmlTextReaderImpl.ParseText(Int32 ByRef, Int32 ByRef, Int32 ByRef)

fields.summary: Source Tree refuse to Start on Windows 10

fields.description:
Source: https://groups.google.com/forum/?atlassian-sourcetree-beta/TUm4XrlDoek/2Nvw9yZ1BgAJ#!topic/atlassian-sourcetree-beta/TUm4XrlDoek

Hello,
I often work with multiple origins, like this
 !image-2016-04-28-18-56-44-309.png|thumbnail! 

When the branch is checked out, I prepend the origin name to recognize which develop is referring to which origin
 !image-2016-04-28-18-56-54-734.png|thumbnail! 

When I need to push the branch, SourceTree does not recognize the origin where the branch came from, and then does not select the branch and the proper origin
 !image-2016-04-28-18-57-06-580.png|thumbnail! 

With the develop branch (of the main origin) SourceTree properly select remote branch

My feature suggestion is that SourceTree can keep in memory which branch comes from which origin (and of course give the possibility to alter the default behaviour)

So when I need to push that branch, it automatically select the proper origin and the proper remote branch.
fields.summary: Working with multiple origin, keeping track of the origin of each branch

fields.description:
I am working on a project with 2 others developers. Today was quite busy with merges and conflict resolution and we eventually got to the situation in the picture attached.
During merges, I never changed the commit message.

As you can see, the merge "Merge branch 'master' into US_543" is incorrectly drawn as if the source was DEV_513_3 rather than master.
fields.summary: Tree graph shows incorrect source of merge

fields.description:
h3. Summary
A user stages files while in the {{Log/History}} tab of SourceTree.
He then either clicks the {{Commit}} button, or selects the {{File Status}} tab.
The staged files are sometimes not preserved in the {{File Status}} tab. 

h3. Environment
SourceTree for Windows 1.8.3

h3. Steps to Reproduce
This behavior cannot be reproduced consistently. I have noticed it happens more often for repos whose tab is open when I open SourceTree. But this behavior seems to be intermittent.
# Open SourceTree
# In a repo whose tab is open, make some changes to a file
# Stage the file while in {{Log/History}} tab
# Click the {{Commit}} button from the toolbar

h3. Expected Results
You are now in the {{File Status}} tab and the previous file remains staged.

h3. Actual Results
You are now in the {{File Status}} tab and the previous file shows as unstaged sometimes.
Other times the file remains staged.

h3. Notes
From SourceTree log, the following error is logged:
{code}
ERROR [2016-04-28 13:33:24,763] [1] [SourceTree.Bookmarks.BookmarkManager] [RegisterBookmarkEventHandlers] - RegisterAsRepositoryUpdatedEventHandler called with null repo
{code}
fields.summary: Staged files are not always preserved from 'Log/History' tab to 'File Status' tab

fields.description:
Since Git LFS version 1.1.1, cloning or pulling in SourceTree when using OpenSSH no longer works, reporting 

{noformat}
Use `git lfs logs last` to view the log.

error: external filter git-lfs smudge -- %f failed
{noformat}

The git-lfs logs report:

{noformat}
fork/exec C:\Users\steve\Documents\projects\SourceTree\bin\Debug\tools\openssh_wrapper.sh: %1 is not a valid Win32 application.
goroutine 1 [running]:
github.com/github/git-lfs/lfs.Stack(0x0, 0x0, 0x0)
        /Users/rick/go/src/github.com/github/git-lfs/lfs/errors.go:566 +0x80
github.com/github/git-lfs/commands.logPanicToWriter(0x1034198, 0x112c28d0, 0x10385c8, 0x112c2898)
        /Users/rick/go/src/github.com/github/git-lfs/commands/commands.go:195 +0xd00
github.com/github/git-lfs/commands.logPanic(0x10385c8, 0x112c2898, 0x0, 0x0)
        /Users/rick/go/src/github.com/github/git-lfs/commands/commands.go:159 +0x35a
github.com/github/git-lfs/commands.handlePanic(0x10385c8, 0x112c2898, 0x0, 0x0)
        /Users/rick/go/src/github.com/github/git-lfs/commands/commands.go:134 +0x46
github.com/github/git-lfs/commands.LoggedError(0x10385c8, 0x112c2898, 0x8a7120, 0x21, 0x1130de3c, 0x2, 0x2)
        /Users/rick/go/src/github.com/github/git-lfs/commands/commands.go:84 +0x59
github.com/github/git-lfs/commands.smudgeCommand(0xa88f80, 0x11358760, 0x1, 0x2)
        /Users/rick/go/src/github.com/github/git-lfs/commands/command_smudge.go:79 +0xb88
github.com/github/git-lfs/vendor/_nuts/github.com/spf13/cobra.(*Command).execute(0xa88f80, 0x11358690, 0x2, 0x2, 0x0, 0x0)
        /Users/rick/go/src/github.com/github/gitlfs/vendor/_nuts/github.com/spf13/cobra/command.go:477 +0x2d8
github.com/github/git-lfs/vendor/_nuts/github.com/spf13/cobra.(*Command).Execute(0xa89840, 0x0, 0x0)
        /Users/rick/go/src/github.com/github/gitlfs/vendor/_nuts/github.com/spf13/cobra/command.go:551 +0x44f
{noformat}

The problem is that git-lfs recently started to support the {{GIT_SSH}} environment variable, which SourceTree sets to {{openssh_wrapper.sh}} in order to turn off things like user prompts. While that works perfectly well from Git, which is operating inside a Git Bash environment, git-lfs is a Windows executable which does not understand how to directly call a Bash shell script.

Temporary workaround is to use PuTTY for SSH, or HTTPS URLs.
fields.summary: SourceTree + Git LFS + OpenSSH fails to clone/pull

fields.description: When switching between repo tabs, view tabs should remember last active tab or allow to reorder them. When I mostly uses *Log/History* tab, is really annoying when switching between repos and everytime the *File Status* tab is activated.
fields.summary: Remember the order of view tabs

fields.description:
On a computer with freshly installed SourceTree and git I experienced the following behavior:
# I open the clone dialog and paste the url to a repo on a server that my machine hasn't been in contact with
# SourceTree checks the source but never completes. Cloning is impossible.

SourceTree is using PuTTY behind the scenes, PuTTY tries to establish a connection but issues a warning since the host's fingerprint is unknown:

 !image-2016-04-28-10-36-00-034.png|thumbnail! 

However, this message box is hidden in SourceTree, The only way to confirm the fingerprint is to start PuTTY manually and connect to the host. Once it is confirmed in PuTTY it works in SourceTreee as well.

Please fix this, it has caused us quite some headache.
fields.summary: SourceTree hides the fingerprint security alert dialog, causing hang

fields.description:
In the windows beta you can now reorder tabs but it looks like the tab order isn't persisted between application restarts. The tabs always reopen in the order that the repositories were selected / opened.

To reproduce:
1) Open multiple repositories. Note the order
2) Reorder the tabs
3) Restart Sourcetree
4) Note that tabs are in the original order, not the reordered order
fields.summary: Tabs can be reordered but order is not persisted

fields.description:
On  the Log/History view, or File Status view, if you have 2+ files which have enough diffs to require vertical scrollbars, if you scroll part way through File #1, when you switch to File #2, the scroll position will persist from File #1.

Suggested behaviour:

# Remember scroll position per file, initial location 0%
# Reset scroll position to 0% whenever switching to a new file
fields.summary: Diff Scrollbar Location Persists Between Files

fields.description: Can we please have a filter of the remote branches in the Graph view. We have tons of remote branches (mostly user branches) and I don't really care about most of them. Can we please have a filter in the view or on the left hand nav side where we can have an icon besides remote repo to view/hide it in Graph view.
fields.summary: Allow filtering of remote branches in the Graph view

fields.description: Needed quick select arbitrary code snippet for copying in clipboard without signs '+' and '-'.
fields.summary: Needed quick select arbitrary code snippet for copying in clipboard without signs '+' and '-'.

fields.description:
When performing a 'git reset'  on a commit, currently, the user is presented with a git reset dialog box, the options are presented in a combobox where the user will have to click the combobox to select an option.

Suggestion: Use radio buttons instead of a combobox to select an option to save a click for a user
fields.summary: Use radio buttons instead of combobox for the options on the Git Reset dialog

fields.description:
When viewing the "Working Copy", shrinking (not on expanding) the left panel (file view), a scrollbar appears then immediately disappears causing an annoying flashing/glitchiness.

See attachment for scrollbar location.
fields.summary: Shrinking File Panel Causes Scrollbar Glitch

fields.description: I had to bring the memory on my VM down to 2Gb in order to get it started. ST crashes started happening. Brought the memory back to 4Gb, but crashes still happening. Log attached.
fields.summary: Crash on startup

fields.description: see https://support.atlassian.com/browse/STSP-4057
fields.summary: External Diff cannot be started for renamed files (Windows)

fields.description:
to replicate:
1. On a list of staged files select a file
2. hit `CTRL` + `SHIFT` + `R` to discard changes
3. file list window has lost focus, now you can't navigate up or down to process other files using keyboard, you have to use mouse again.
fields.summary: After performing an action on unstaged files view the unstaged files list loses focus

fields.description:
SourceTree connected to a Git repo.
On a detached head that was back 7 commits from my most recent commit (so HEAD = master - 7 commits)
right-clicked on master - 6 commits and selected Cherry Pick
(Glanced away so I didn't see the progress dialog feedback)
In terms of UI, the next thing I noticed was the "oops, we crashed" message.

Restarted source tree
Current state is that HEAD has moved forward to a new commit that has the merged results of adding the cherry picked commit to where I was. No conflicts to clear. The current state looks fine.

The crash seems to have happened all the work against the Git repo was completed.
No current issue for me, this is a rare operation for me, personally, no need for a fix.
fields.summary: crash on cherry pick to a detached head

fields.description: sorry, cant work with mercurial because of crashing on comitting
fields.summary: crashing on windows 10 while comitting mercurial

fields.description:
I would like to have to opportunity to have a "Go Into" feature like Eclipse IDE has; for the book mark view. When having a lot of bookmarked projects or a project which is made up of multiple repositories. Having a "Go Into" like Eclipse would be quite helpfull.

Of course I would like it when you can use the "Go Into" feature for SourceTree for All folders, root as well as sub folders etc.

Attached a screenshot of the feature of eclipse.
fields.summary: Add ability to navigate within bookmarked projects or a project which is made up of multiple repositories.

fields.description:
Source Tree application crashed while trying to pull the just added subtree.

Steps were:
1. Create new repository in the Source Tree
2. Add a link to a subtree
3. Right click on the added subtree in the previous step from Subtrees menu and click pull
4. Confirm the pull
Result: Shource Tree crashed.

Unable to reproduce.
fields.summary: Source Tree crashed while trying to pull from the just added subtree

fields.description: Not supporting GPG-signed commits seems like a major oversight in an otherwise strong product.  This is already supported in the MacOS version, why not in the Windows version?
fields.summary: Support for GPG signed commits

fields.description:
chrash log:

fields.summary: Crash after pushing

fields.description: Give the ability of hiding Sourcetree in the systray
fields.summary: Hide application in systray

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
If a user has many repo tabs open, it may be a bit inconvenient to scroll to find the ones they want.

h3. Suggested Solution
Having a list or a drop-down that shows all open repo tabs would be easier for navigation.
fields.summary: As a user I want to see a list of all open repositories

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When a repository has no changes, no sign shows below its name. Up to version 1.7 a green check would show in the bookmark, making it easier to distinguish those with no changes.

h3. Suggested Solution
Show a green check in the bookmark of repos with no changes.
fields.summary: As a user I want to see a green mark in the bookmark of a repository that has no changes

fields.description:
Open in Explorer option disabled in context menu

 !image-2016-04-25-15-12-58-644.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Open in Explorer option disabled

fields.description:
I can press the menu item and run it, 
but the "window"/"dialog" for changing the commits never shows up

NOT the same as 
* https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/SRCTREEWIN-5357
* https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/SRCTREEWIN-5422

(Observation from 1.9.0.5)
If the current branch has remote tracking branch, it shows the output with `console_output`
If the current branch has NO remote tracking branch, it shows the output with `19_console_output`

Just tried to run the command in console manually:
```
$ git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false -c sequence.editor='C:\Users\PikachuEXE\AppData\Local\SourceTree\app-1.9.0-beta-5\tools\stree_gri' -c core.editor='C:\Users\PikachuEXE\AppData\Local\SourceTree\app-1.9.0-beta-5\tools\stree_gri' rebase -i --autosquash c023719dae827df5cb2a42880691db2c0bc830d4
Could not execute editor
```
fields.summary: 1.8.3.0 cannot rebase interactively

fields.description: Keeps hanging when clicking in source tree, will not respond, causes other apps to slow down, have to reboot, it has become unusable.  Windows is fine, am using many other apps with no issues. Am now trying to revert back to 1.7 for the second time. Have only had problems with Sourcetree since 1.7, it was a fine app before then! I will be reluctant to upgrade it again. I have swung from praising Sourcetree to now losing confidence that I can depend on it to backup my work.
fields.summary: Unusable with Windows 10

fields.description:
If you're working in the "Uncommitted changes" view, click on a pending file, then up/down arrow.

This will change the selected file, which in turn changes the diff pane.

However, the diff pane now refreshes about once per second, and on refresh, it _steals focus_ in the application.  Hitting Up/Up/Up/Up/Up will move up until a refresh, then stop working.

This is incredibly annoying.  The refreshing also causes a visual flicker that's distracting if it's left running.  Would be nice if the refresh was non-visual (unless there's an actual change)
fields.summary: Constant refreshing of changes steals focus

fields.description:
when you right click a file in the unstaged files area and choose ignore from the menu a window pops open.

Here you can choose different path depths in a combobox.

BUG: when you select a value from this combobox the selected radio button does not switch to "ignore everything beneath".

It occured to me several times already that I thought I saved the path to be excluded only to find out I had not ALSO set the radio button.

An alternative could be to make the checkbox read only when the corresponding radio button is not selected
fields.summary: changing ignore everything beneath dropdown input does not update radiobutton

fields.description:
I have a repository with a branch that adds a submodule to my project. When trying to checkout this branch or when trying to open the repository in sourcetree while this branch is checked out, SourceTree crashes. The crash does not happen immediately, but after about 2 seconds while loading/refreshing the sidebar and log view.

As far as I can tell the error is caused by an Exception when SourceTree tries to access the .git file in the submodule as a folder. I have sent the error report when SourceTree asked me to do so.
fields.summary: Crash when opening repository with submodule

fields.description:
Some stashes are displayed even when stashes dropdown is closed. The attached images show the problem in UI. Sorry for scribbling them

stash1.jpg shows that stashes dropdown is closed, however it displays a stash under the drop-down UI.

stash2.jpg shows that stashes dropdown is open, and all stashes are normally displayed.
fields.summary: Stashes Dropdown UI Bug

fields.description: When change files and what to create a commit the changed files appears in "Unstaged files" section so i click in general checkbox to add all at once bug it stay loading forever, I need to click in a random one and then they appear in  the "Staged files" section
fields.summary: Staged files stay loading for forever
